name: WikiUpdaterTask
friendlyName: Git based WIKI Single File Updater from Black Marble
description: A tools to update or create a file in a WIKI based in a Git repo
author: Richard Fennell

inputs.name: repo
inputs.label: Repo
inputs.helpMarkDown: The repo URL to clone e.g dev.azure.com/richardfennell/Git%20project/_git/Git-project.wiki. See documentation for more details https://github.com/rfennell/AzurePipelines/wiki/WIKI-Updater-Tasks

inputs.name: branch
inputs.label: Checkout Branch
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the pre-existing branch to checkout prior to committing the change, defaults to empty, so no checkout is done and commits are done to the default 'master' branch

inputs.name: filename
inputs.label: Name of the file/page
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the file (page) that will be updated or created, must end in .md else it will not appear on the WIKI e.g. page.md

inputs.name: replaceFile
inputs.label: Replace the file in the WIKI
inputs.helpMarkDown: Replace the file in the WIKI

inputs.name: appendToFile
inputs.label: Append to end of file in the WIKI
inputs.helpMarkDown: Append to end of file in the WIKI if not replacing file

inputs.name: dataIsFile
inputs.label: Data is a file
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true will upload a file, if false the upload is the content provided

inputs.name: contents
inputs.label: Contents
inputs.helpMarkDown: If DataIsFile is false, this text to save in the file, can be the output from another task passed as pipeline variable

inputs.name: sourceFile
inputs.label: Source File
inputs.helpMarkDown: If DataIsFile is true, this is the filename to upload, will be renamed to the value of the 'filename' parameter

inputs.name: message
inputs.label: Commit Message
inputs.helpMarkDown: The commit message

inputs.name: tagRepo
inputs.label: Tag the commit
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true a tag will be commited to the repo

inputs.name: tag
inputs.label: Tag
inputs.helpMarkDown: Tag text to commit to repo

inputs.name: gitname
inputs.label: Git Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Git attributes name

inputs.name: gitemail
inputs.label: Git Email
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Git attributes email

inputs.name: useAgentToken
inputs.label: Run with Build Agent Credentials
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true use the built in agent OAUTH token. OAUTH script access must be enabled for the agent

inputs.name: user
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: The username for authentication

inputs.name: password
inputs.label: Password/PAT
inputs.helpMarkDown: The password/PAT for authentication (recommended stored as secret variable)

inputs.name: localpath
inputs.label: The local folder to clone into
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to clone into

inputs.name: injectExtraHeader
inputs.label: Inject credentials via Headers
inputs.helpMarkDown: If set to true, credentials are passed as a header value. If false, the default, they are passed in te URL. To address #613 which is seen on some on-prem instances

inputs.name: retries
inputs.label: Retries
inputs.helpMarkDown: The number of times to retry if a push fails. After a failed push a pull is run prior to the next attempt, default of 5

inputs.name: trimLeadingSpecialChar
inputs.label: Trim Leading Special Character
inputs.helpMarkDown: The appending or prepending files prior to uploading a leading special character gets added to the file. Setting this flag to true removes this first character.

inputs.name: fixLineFeeds
inputs.label: Fix Line Feeds
inputs.helpMarkDown: If set to true, `n are swapped to \r\n as this is required for most WIKIs. If false no replacement is made, this should be used for non-text based files e.g. images or PDFs. Only used when replacing the target file

inputs.name: fixSpaces
inputs.label: Fix spaces in filename
inputs.helpMarkDown: If set to true, and space in the target filename are replaced by -

inputs.name: insertLinefeed
inputs.label: Insert Linefeed
inputs.helpMarkDown: If set to true, when appending or prepending content a newline is inserted between the old and new content

inputs.name: updateOrderFile
inputs.label: Update .order file
inputs.helpMarkDown: If set to true, an new line for the uploaded file will be appending, or prepending, in the Azure DevOps WIKI .order file in the root of the repo. If the file does not exist it will be created

inputs.name: orderFilePath
inputs.label: The path to .order file
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the folder containing the .order file to update. If empty the .order file in the root of the WIKI will be used.

inputs.name: prependEntryToOrderFile
inputs.label: Prepend .order file entry
inputs.helpMarkDown: If updateOrderFile is set to true, this parameter control whether the new entry is appended (when this is set to false) or prepending (when this is set to true)
